Dereference of a possibly null reference.
Prefer 'static readonly' fields over constant array arguments if the called method is called repeatedly and is not mutating the passed array

CA1861.fullDescription: Constant arrays passed as arguments are not reused when called repeatedly, which implies a new array is created each time. Consider extracting them to 'static readonly' fields to improve performance if the passed array is not mutated within the called method.

CS8602.shortDescription: Dereference of a possibly null reference.

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.
